ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about how to control a plant. I learned about laplace transforms, Z transforms, Fourier Transforms, transfer functions, mass/energy balances, control loops and diagrams, and various tools in MATLAB like PID Tuner and Simulink.
I learned a lot about process control

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths
- very organized
- professor is nice and is willing to meet a lot to help
- the first half of the class is doable
Weaknesses
- VERY DIFFICULT
- there is a final project, a final, and PSets all happening at once. The second half of the class has a miserable workload. Definitely in future years break it up or get rid of the final project alltogether
- TA sucks

I thought it was a good course. At the beginning of the semester, the workload was manageable. But once the final project was assigned, the workload was very heavy (having 2 assignments due each week and a final exam and final project both due during finals period).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Nope lol. It's a hard class and only take it if it's absolutely required. Altman is pretty nice, but the material is very difficult and uninteresting for a good part of it. Plus it's just SO MUCH WORK at the end.
Inly if you are really interested in process control

You'll only take this course if you're ChemE ABET. The first month or so of class was extremely doable and the pacing seemed fair. The course really picks up once the final project is assigned and the course load doubles. Professor Altman is really transparent about this. He's also extremely helpful and easy to reach. If you take this course, go to office hours and start the project right away. Professor Altman is, of course, helpful when it comes to homework and the project, but he's also really good at explaining course content by meeting you where you're at. The course will consume your semester, but it is manageable and Professor Altman is really great.
